panels.description: Estimated Couchbase changes yet to be processed by this node.
panels.title: Estimated Backlog

panels.description: An estimate of the number of bytes the connector has written to Elasticsearch.
panels.title: Connector Data Written/sec

panels.description: Document events currently buffered in memory.
panels.title: Connector Write Queue

panels.description: Duration of in-flight Elasticsearch bulk request (including any retries). Long duration may indicate connector has stalled.
panels.title: Elasticsearch Wait Seconds

panels.description: Permanent indexing failure; usually result in an entry being added to the rejection log Elasticsearch index.
panels.title: Docs Rejected

panels.description: Failed to save a replication checkpoint document to Couchbase.
panels.title: Checkpoint Save Failures

panels.description: Failure to write an individual document. (For each `bulkRetry` event, one or more `docWriteRetry` events are recorded, indicating how many failures there were in the bulk request.)
panels.title: Individual Doc Retries Due to Failure

panels.description: Failed Elasticsearch connection attempts.
panels.title: Elasticsearch Failed Connections

panels.description: Failure to add a record to the rejection log Elasticsearch index.
panels.title: Rejection Log Failures

panels.description: Elasticsearch bulk request retry due to a temporary failure.
panels.title: Bulk Retries Due to Failure

panels.description: Duration of an Elasticsearch bulk request (including retries), divided by the number of items in the bulk request.
panels.title: Max per Doc Index Latency

panels.description: The time between when the connector is notified of a database change and when the change is written to Elasticsearch.
panels.title: Connector Avg. Latency

panels.description: Time spent waiting after a temporary indexing failure before the request is retried.
panels.title: Elasticsearch Indexing Retry Delay

panels.description: Time spent preparing an Elasticsearch indexing request.
panels.title: Preparing Index Request Latency

panels.description: The status of the DCP Connection for the Remote
panels.title: DCP Connection Status

panels.description: The total number of DCP connects
panels.title: DCP Connects

panels.description: The total number of DCP disconnects
panels.title: DCP Disconnects

panels.description: The total # of client DCP requests for various operations
panels.title: DCP Client Requests

panels.description: The number of DCP pooling tasks
panels.title: DCP Scheduled Pooling Tasks

panels.description: The amount of times that DCP connections have been reconfigured
panels.title: DCP Reconfigures

panels.description: The total number of DCP remove channel events
panels.title: DCP Remove Channel Events

panels.description: The total number of DCP add channel events
panels.title: DCP Add Channel

panels.description: The number of classes that are currently loaded in the Java virtual machine
panels.title: JVM Loaded Classes

panels.description: The total number of classes unloaded since the Java virtual machine has started execution
panels.title: JVM Unloaded Classes

panels.description: An estimate of the number of buffers in the pool
panels.title: JVM Buffer Count

panels.description: An estimate of the memory that the Java virtual machine is using for this buffer pool
panels.title: JVM Buffer Memory Used

panels.description: The current number of live daemon threads
panels.title: JVM Daemon Threads

panels.description: The peak live thread count since the Java virtual machine started or peak was reset
panels.title: JVM Peak Threads

panels.description: The current number of live threads including both daemon and non-daemon threads
panels.title: JVM Live Threads

panels.description: The current number of threads having NEW state
panels.title: JVM Thread States

panels.description: An estimate of the total capacity of the buffers in this pool
panels.title: Pool Buffer Capacity

panels.description: The amount of used memory
panels.title: Memory Bytes Used (heap)

panels.description: The maximum amount of memory in bytes that can be used for memory management
panels.title: Memory Bytes Max (heap)

panels.description: The memory used / memory max.  Values with a -1 max are excluded, as they are unlimited
panels.title: Memory Utilization (nonheap)

panels.description: The amount of used memory
panels.title: Memory Bytes Used (nonheap)

panels.description: The maximum amount of memory in bytes that can be used for memory management
panels.title: Memory Bytes Max (nonheap)

panels.description: The memory used / memory max.  Values with a -1 max are excluded, as they are unlimited
panels.title: Memory Utilization (heap)

panels.description: The amount of memory in bytes that is committed for the Java virtual machine to use
panels.title: Memory Bytes Committed (heap)

panels.description: The amount of memory in bytes that is committed for the Java virtual machine to use
panels.title: Memory Bytes Committed (nonheap)

panels.description: Size of long-lived heap memory pool after reclamation
panels.title: GC Live Data Size

panels.description: Count of positive increases in the size of the old generation memory pool before GC to after GC
panels.title: GC Pool Increases (Before/After)

panels.description: Incremented for an increase in the size of the (young) heap memory pool after one GC to before the next
panels.title: JVM GC Allocated Bytes

panels.description: Time spent in GC pause
panels.title: GC Pause Time
